subject: Start Your Online Workout | Term 4 Class Bookings Open

What to do in the Term Break
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Have issue viewing this email? Click here
Hi Support,

We hope you are having a great week and getting out to enjoy the beautiful spring weather.

Our Term 3 classes are starting to wind down.

With Melinda off to Europe for the next 3 weeks Brendan is teaching the last week of the Restore, Rebuild and Refine classes.

Next week Brendan will be off on holiday for 3 weeks.

That leaves Patrick, Roisin and Jane to hold down the clinic.

For those only doing Clinical Exercise Classes this leaves a big break between terms.

Some of you have Refit, Rebound, Qigong and Yoga classes to keep you going.

Read on below to see how you can keep up your exercise/movement routine over the next 4 weeks.

We look forward to seeing you all back for Term 4.

And those keen on joining classes for Term 4, we still have lots of spots available.

See you in the clinic soon!

Team Redo
In this Newsletter

Start Your Online Workout

Refit and Rebound Classes with Patrick this September

Term 4 Class Availabilities - Availabilities

New on the Blog - Redefining Menopause
Start Your Online Workout
Redo Online started back in 2021 when we launched our new website. It has been a useful tool for those limited to exercising at home, those wanting to do additional classes or keeping up exercise during our term breaks.

With Melinda and Brendan away for the next 3 weeks this would be a great way for many to keep moving and their "class momentum" going!

Redo Online is web-based exercise platform.

It includes over 300 class videos taught by Brendan, Melinda and Adam.

Join now for $9.99/week with no commitment to stay on.

For those participating in Studio Classes for Term 4 check your inbox for a special offer email.

Learn more here.

Refit & Rebound Classes This September

Another option for classes this September while Brendan and Melinda are away is to try a class (or three) with Patrick in one of his Rebound or Refit classes on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

The best thing to do is book your first class and then discuss with Patrick options and availability for classes over the next few weeks.

Available classes.

REFIT
Tuesdays at 7:00AM
Thursdays at 4:30PM

Book 1st REFIT class


REBOUND
Tuesdays at 9:30AM
Thursdays at 10:00AM
Thursdays at 2:00PM

Book 1st REBOUND class



Whats the difference between REFIT and REBOUND?

REBOUND classes
A medium to high-intensity strength and conditioning group class, carefully curated with a focus on recovery, rehabilitation, and prevention from injury, surgery, or chronic illness.

Recovery Focus: Designed with injury & chronic illness in mind for health & wellbeing.
Guided Expertise: Exercise alongside our experienced Exercise Physiologist.
Tailored Exercises: Personalised support to suit your unique needs.
Fun & Social: Increase motivation, connect with others, & make movement fun again.
Flexible Options: Kickstart a complete program or join our casual classes.


REFIT classes

A dynamic high-intensity strength and conditioning class designed to challenge your body and mind to help you rebuild your strength and fitness, feel energised and youthful, and boost longevity.
Strength Focus: Designed with full body strength building in mind to boost vitality.
Guided Expertise: Exercise alongside our experienced Exercise Physiologist.
Tailored Exercises: Personalised support to suit your unique needs.
Fun & Social: Increase motivation, connect with others, & make movement fun again.
Flexible Options: Kickstart a complete program or join our casual classes.
Refit & Rebound Classes This September

Menopause is a moment in time marking 12 months since your last period, a medical diagnosis or cut off point saying that is it, your time of menstruating is up and you are now into the next stage of your life.
The lead up to this can be slow and gradual or sometimes quite sudden.
Due to the change in how your body is now functioning through hormone changes mostly, women can have dreadful symptoms, mild symptoms or none at all.
It is something that hasn't been talked about openly over the years and then it has been somewhat caricatured by women with uncontrollable temperature regulation and outbursts.
There has also historically been a lot of confusion as to how to manage and care for your body in this time of transition whether it is hormone therapy, diet, stress management etc.
I had the opportunity to meet one of the experts Thea O'Conner, Director of Menopause at Work Asia Pacific., speaking at the recent senate enquiry on menopause and the workplace and she agreed to share some of the findings and tools that she works with in her corporate and individual programs.

Here is what she had to say…

Thank you for trusting us to support you on your journey toward long-term health. We hope you were satisfied with your recent experience!

As we strive to continuously improve our services and help more people like you, your feedback is incredibly helpful.

Could you spare 30 seconds to share your experience with us?


To leave your feedback click here.
Recent Blog Posts
Your Guide to Clinical Exercise Classes by Physiotherapists vs Exercise Physiologists at Redo

In the world of health and fitness, the guidance of experienced health professionals can steer individuals towards their wellness objectives with precision. RedoHealth offers a spectrum of clinical exercise classes led by both physiotherapists and exercise physiologists. These instructors, each with their specialised expertise, tailor their classes to meet the diverse needs of participants.
Let's delve deeper into the distinctions between Physiotherapist-led and Exercise Physiologist-led classes at RedoHealth, highlighting their unique approaches and focal points.

Read more
What is an Exercise Physiologist?

An Exercise Physiologist (EP) is an allied healthcare professional who specialises in the study of how the human body responds to physical activity and exercise.
Exercise Physiologists have a strong knowledge based in human physiology and use this to design and implement exercise programs to help individuals achieve specific health and fitness goals, prevent or manage chronic health conditions, and improve overall well-being.

Read More
Archies Arch Support Thongs: Footwear with Comfort and Style

In Australia, thongs are just a part of our footwear culture. For some, they are the footwear of choice when going to the beach or running out to the shops. For others, they live in their thongs, maybe a bit too much?
This is one of the key reasons why I tell people to wear their thongs less, specifically when treating the feet for foot-related pain/problems.
Your thongs mold to your feet and a lack of variety in your footwear may reinforce poor muscle patterning in the feet that develops from wearing too much of one shoe (Or thong).
As a Physiotherapist, I have never recommended a pair of thongs.
Until now.

Read more.
